intro: Levenhookia, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly rough texture. Its showy, purple-pink flower heads consist of both ray and disk flowers, attracting various pollinators. Levenhookia is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
